summary: Bitcoin's price fell sharply late Thursday morning, a move that came after days of steady gains.
title: Bitcoin price dips sharply ahead of DOJ crypto enforcement announcement
content: Bitcoin's price fell sharply late Thursday morning after the U.S. Departments of Justice and Treasury said they would announce a joint enforcement action against an international crypto entity today.
The price fell more than $800, reaching $20,777, according to data from TradingView. The price had earlier reached a daily high of $21,650.
Bitcoin's price has regained some of that ground and is trading hands at about $20,900 as of press time.
Still, bitcoin's price is well above the roughly $16,600 level where it began the year.
